title: West Yorkshire Association Football League
text:
The West Yorkshire Association Football League is a <a href="association%20football">football</a> competition based in <a href="Yorkshire">Yorkshire</a>, <a href="England">England</a>. It was previously known as the Leeds League until the name change in 1939. Although it is named the "West Yorkshire" League, clubs from the <a href="Harrogate">Harrogate</a> and <a href="York">York</a> areas of <a href="North%20Yorkshire">North Yorkshire</a> also play in the competition.
Currently the league has three senior team divisions, and two for reserves. Officially part of the <a href="National%20League%20System">National League System</a>, the Premier Division is a step 7 (or level 11) league in the pyramid. Clubs are able to be promoted to the <a href="Northern%20Counties%20East%20Football%20League">Northern Counties East Football League</a> or the <a href="North%20West%20Counties%20Football%20League">North West Counties Football League</a>; <a href="Knaresborough%20Town%20A.F.C.">Knaresborough Town</a> in 2012 were accepted by the Northern Counties East League and <a href="Shelley%20Community%20F.C.">Shelley Community</a> were accepted by the <a href="North%20West%20Counties%20League">North West Counties League</a> in 2018.
Some other teams who once played in the West Yorkshire League but now play their football at higher levels of the pyramid, include <a href="A.F.C.%20Emley">AFC Emley</a>, <a href="Harrogate%20Town%20F.C.">Harrogate Town</a>, <a href="Harrogate%20Railway%20Athletic%20F.C.">Harrogate Railway Athletic</a>, <a href="Ossett%20Town%20A.F.C.">Ossett Town</a> (now merged with <a href="Ossett%20Albion%20A.F.C.">Ossett Albion</a> to form <a href="Ossett%20United%20F.C.">Ossett United</a>), Thackley and <a href="Garforth%20Town%20A.F.C.">Garforth Town</a>.
